item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group offering insurance and wealth management solutions in the US, Canada, Europe, and Asia

We are on a transformational journey. We want to remove complexity from the financial services industry, to make people’s lives better by helping to make their decisions easier. Being part of this transformation is hugely exciting and offers talented, ambitious people an amazing opportunity to build a career. If that sounds like you, then we want to hear from you.

We are looking for a Data Science Engineer to join our Advanced Customer Analytics team. Your job will be to support initiatives that improve client experience and outcomes. Your primary responsibility will be researching and developing a global customer analytics record that will be used to identify insights and develop targeted, digital interventions. 

Who We Are
 

Manulife’s Advanced Customer Analytics team works across our global insurance and wealth management businesses to accelerate the use of Advanced Analytics & AI in understanding the voice of the customer – both what they say and how they interact with us.  With an eye towards creating personalized products and digital service experiences we will play a key role in the organizations commitment to be a digital, customer leader. 
 

What You Will Do

You will be at the center of where Advanced Analytics meets customer experience. As part of a team dedicated to Advanced Customer Analytics, you will help enable predictive servicing solutions, use Natural Language Processing techniques to understand the voice of the customer, experiment with journey analytics to resolve pain points in our online experiences.  You will support the research and development of a global customer analytics record - the foundation for all other work.

 
The Role Will Be Directly Responsible For

  • Supporting the creation of a global customer analytics record encompassing all elements of meaningful customer data, curated for Advanced Analytics & AI use cases

  • Identifying and investigate data for ingestion across all customer (and key B2B intermediary) experiences including sales, marketing, operations, web, mobile, call centers, and more.

  • Coordinating with global advanced analytics teams, business stakeholders, and technology teams to facilitate last mile delivery of reusable capabilities that can be easily deployed into new markets

  • Developing creative ways to source customer data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data using Big Data technologies

  • Providing thought leadership influences how data insights are delivered to the client throughout Manulife

Typical Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree with 3+ year’s experience, or Master’s with any of the following fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Math, Engineering, Operation Research, Statistics, or other related quantitative fields.

Professional Experience may include

  • Understanding of modern data architecture, data science engineering, data modeling, data quality and manipulation of structured and unstructured data sources using state-of-the-art cloud computing technologies (Azure)

  • Experience delivering analytics & machine learning products, with a deep understanding of agile product delivery in an enterprise environment

  • Some familiarity with Big Data processing and building Data APIs. Experience with automated data quality frameworks is a plus.

  • Entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to creating rigorous, high-quality insights from data, at scale.

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to engage the enterprise across multiple specializations with analytically backed compelling stories

  • Prior experience with insurance or financial services is not required

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. The ideal candidate must be an advanced programmer with a good understanding of Data Science, Data Engineering, Application development, Software Engineering, and DevOps.

Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Math, Engineering, Operation Research, Statistics, or other related quantitative fields. MS or Ph.D. preferred.

  • Manage data science infrastructure to streamline model development and deployment

  • Architecting, developing, optimizing, and owning the deployment of ML functionalities into production systems

  • Hands-on experience with large-scale systems in software engineering

  • Experience in productionizing code through DevOps pipeline (git, Jenkins pipeline, code scan)

  • Familiarity with big data processing and building data APIs. Experience with automated data quality frameworks is a plus.

  • Working experience in building and deploying machine learning models as REST-based API using Flask, Elasticsearch, etc.

  • Strong software development skills with proficiency in Python

  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and SQL

  • Experience in infrastructure, including Cloud Computing, Linux OS, Networks, Docker, Kubernetes, RDBMS and NoSQL Databases

  • Experience working with cloud native architecture (PaaS) using Azure stack preferably and experience with Azure ML, DataBricks (Spark), Azure Data Factory will be an asset.

  • Experience in building ETL pipelines to perform feature engineering on large-scale dataset using Spark

  • An ability to balance a sense of urgency with shipping high quality and pragmatic solutions

  • Experience with user interface design (UX, PowerBI, node.js) and iterative customer-driven design processes would be an asset.

item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

The Manulife Audit Services Data Analytics group supports the global audit teams by collaborating with them to provide meaningful data and successfully employ the use of data analytics in audit activities. These activities cover the different product lines and functions within the company globally. This includes Insurance, Wealth, Investment, and Banking products as well as actuarial and information technology functions.

The position of Analyst, Data Analytics is a key team member in contributing to the development and execution of the Data Analytics group strategy. The successful candidate will bring their innovation, mindset for critical thinking, curiosity and functional expertise, and a passion for using data and analytics tool sets to drive the success of this initiative. This position reports to Director, Audit Data Analytics.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Develops and implements analytics enabled solutions to evaluate controls and audit business objectives on data validation, consolidation and cleansing processes and independently re-performs business processes, and identifies exceptions.

  • Owns and delivers complete projects of moderate complexity to prepare and integrate large and varied datasets to build statistical and machine learning models using Python and R and perform full-population data retrievals and/or sampling on large data sets

  • Works on problems of moderate scope / complexity to Validate and quantify accuracy and precision of analysis.

  • Develop requirements, design, code, test, and analyze results to provide support on audit activities using available tools/infrastructure.

  • Work independently to support individual audits, and collaboratively with both the team and Auditors on larger project

  • Analyze, document, present analytical results Communicates results of cases of moderate complexity to business partners and recommends to audit teams and provide conclusions/recommendations on data related issues.

  

Job Requirement:

  • Bachelor\'s Degree in a technical (computer science, statistics, math, etc.) or generally an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline.

  • Working knowledge in data analytics/data management/programming experience, Machine-Learning, data mining and statistics.

  • Working knowledge of SQL, Python, VBA, MS Excel, Data Extraction and Data Mining tools.

  • Experience with visualization tools, Power BI, or Tableau will be an open source visualization libraries.

  • Experience with data gathering, storing, and retrieval methods

  • Experience working with various data platforms; structured and unstructured

  • Sound or developing business acumen

  • Knowledge or desire to learn text analytics

  • Knowledge or desire to learn statistical techniques (e.g., regression, cluster, decision trees)

  • Insurance or Financial Services industry experience preferred

Competencies:

  • Strong technical knowledge of data and data concepts

  • Detailed oriented with a problem solving mind set

  • Displays strong relationship building mindset and skills

  • Employ analytical, conceptual, and creative thinking skills to problem solve and get results

  • Able to prioritize, meet deadlines, and be results orientated

  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complexity with clarity to diverse technical and non-technical stakeholders at multiple levels of the organization

  • Turn statistical and computational analysis into user-friendly graphs, charts, and animation. Ability to communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations

  • Strong commitment to organizational success, share resources and leverages knowledge across the organization

  • Adaptable and open to change

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Job Description

Manulife/John Hancock is looking for an exceptional senior data scientist to lead a center of excellence for the global retirement business. This role requires broad knowledge of predictive analytics techniques and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues, including sales, distribution, marketing and pricing.  This is a unique opportunity to join a creative and passionate growing team within a Fortune 500 organization. It is a lean, flat and experimental team that combines science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into business operation.  

 

Key Focus: Reporting to the Head of Analytics for US Retirement, the senior data scientist will take a leading part in the management of the analytics data environment as well as the review, creation and deployment of existing and new advanced models. The ideal candidate will have experience in a range of the big data space and technologies and stays on top of new development, trends and applies data engineering and science into the marketing and sales organization. The Senior Data Scientist develops and implements analytics enabled solutions to improve business process, to generate insights, support business goals and strategy development. The Senior Data Scientist also owns and delivers projects of diverse scope, oversees the work of more junior data scientists.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead technical projects that span the global retirement business with high impact on sales growth, business profitability, client retention and customer satisfaction

  • Lead complex data mining projects from creation, evaluation, testing and continuously improving using machine learning, and other modeling concepts

  • Innovate and find creative ways to source and use data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data, and big data technologies

  • Handle data sets from disparate sources using appropriate engineering methodologies, computational frameworks and systems

  • Work with cross-functional global team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas.

  • Provide expertise on analytics concepts for the broader advanced analytics group, and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics, data engineering and data science across the organization

  • Oversees the work of junior data scientists.

​

Education, Experience & Skills:

  • Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)

  • 3+ plus years developing of probabilistic models, data mining, and machine learning algorithms including real world experience in model development validation and testing and implementation

  • Experience in finance, marketing, Fin-tech industry is preferred

  • Expert in data analysis using Python, R, SQL; familiar with big data system, NoSQL systems, Hadoop/map-reduce, Spark, etc.

  • Track record of leading projects of diverse scope; independently provides analysis on datasets of significant complexity; recommends implementable solutions to (or in collaboration with) business partners

  • Strong data engineering, and data management expertise with demonstrated data transformation and manipulation experience

  • Strong commitment to organizational success and team work; highly focused on accountability.

  • Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely

  • Inspires and motivates others, provides courageous advice.

  • Role model of ethics and integrity who builds a culture of respect.

  • Ability to handle multiple partners

  • Strategic perspective.

  • Highly collaborative working style
